reviews.review_msg: Dr. Peplak is very kind, but her lectures are quite dry. Her grading criteria are also quite unclear. You can tell she is passionate about the material, but the structure and delivery of the course make enjoyment difficult. TAs are very nitpicking with grading too. The only straightforward thing is the exams. But it's tough to stay motivated.

She is passionate. The tests are fair and based off lecture material. You have to attend class for participation activities. Her lecture style is very "there are no wrong answers" which I feel fosters people to participate without depth rather than focused conversation. I have just found other psych profs to be better and go under the surface more.

She will quickly be recognized as SFU's finest. Sally is so caring and empathetic to the student experience. She constantly asks for student feedback on the course and is flexible with deadlines. She presents concepts in relatable and interesting ways. No exams, just easy quizzes, participation, few assignments, and a final paper. She's awesome!
